law.catch_line: Preliminary hearing -- Proof required to try child as youthful offender in Circuit Court.

text.section: For children who are alleged to be youthful offenders by falling in the purview of KRS 635.020(2), (3), (5), (6), (7), or (8), the court shall at arraignment assure that the child's rights as specified in KRS 610.060 have been explained and followed.

If the child is transferred to Circuit Court under this section and the grand jury does not find that there is probable cause to indict the child as a youthful offender, as defined in KRS 635.020(2), (3), (5), (6), (7), and (8), but does find that there is probable cause to indict the child for another criminal offense, the child shall not be tried as a youthful offender in Circuit Court but shall be returned to District Court to be dealt with as provided in KRS Chapter 635.
